      • serialVersionUID

        Determines if a de-serialized file is compatible with this class.

        Maintainers must change this value if and only if the new version of this class is not compatible with old versions.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • acuity

        private static final double acuity
        This [CLASSIT] evaluation function is equivalent to the function used by COBWEB; it is a transformation of category utility. Unfortunately, this transformation introduces a problem when the standard deviation is zero for a concept. For any concept based on a single instance, the value of 1/(standard deviation) is therefore infinite. In order to resolve this problem, we have introduced the notion of acuity, a system parameter that specifies the minimum value for the standard deviation. This limit corresponds to the notion of a "just noticeable difference" in psychophysics - the lower limit on our perception ability. Because acuity strongly affects the score of new disjuncts, it indirectly controls the breadth, or branching factor of the concept hierarchy produced, just as the cutoff parameter controls the depth of the hierarchy.
        See Also:
        H. Gennari, Pat Langley and Doug Fisher: Models of Incremental Concept Formation. Artificial Intelligence 411 (1989) 40., Constant Field Values

      • maxThoereticalPossibleCategoryUtility

        private static final double maxThoereticalPossibleCategoryUtility

    • Method Detail

      • calculateCategoryUtility

        public double calculateCategoryUtility(java.util.Collection<INode> possibleMerge)
        Calculates utility of merging nodes in possibleMerge based on Classit Category Utility formula Utility is calculated as follows: 1. For all attributes calculate 1/stdev 2. Divide the sum of this values by the number of attributes
        Specified by:
        calculateCategoryUtility in class BasicMaxCategoryUtilitySearcher
        Parameters:
        possibleMerge - The nodes for which to calculate the utility
        Returns:
        the utility of merging the nodes in possibleMerge

      • isAttributeKnownToAllMergeNodes

        private boolean isAttributeKnownToAllMergeNodes(java.lang.Object attribute,
                                      java.util.Collection<INode> possibleMerge)
        Checks if the passed attribute is an attribute of all nodes in the passed merge candidate.
        Parameters:
        attribute - the attribute to test
        possibleMerge - the merge candidate
        Returns:
        true if attribute appears in all nodes of possibleMerge, else false.

      • calcSupportOfAttribute

        public static int calcSupportOfAttribute(java.util.Collection<IAttribute> attributes)
        Calculates the support of attribute for the nodes in possibleMerge if these nodes were merged. This method is used as helper to calculate the new average of this attribute when two nodes are merged, or to calculate the standard deviation.
        Parameters:
        attributes - The attributes for which to calculate the support
        Returns:
        support of attribute

      • calcSumOfRatingsOfAttribute

        public static double calcSumOfRatingsOfAttribute(java.util.Collection<IAttribute> attributes)
        Calculates the sum of the ratings for attribute in the nodes in possibleMerge. This method is used as helper to calculate the new average of this attribute when two nodes are merged, or to calculate the standard deviation.
        Parameters:
        attributes - The attributes whose sum needs to be calculated
        Returns:
        The sum of the ratings for attribute in the nodes

      • calcSumOfSquaredRatingsOfAttribute

        public static double calcSumOfSquaredRatingsOfAttribute(java.util.Collection<IAttribute> attributes)
        Calculates the sum of squared ratings of attribute in the nodes in possibleMerge. This method is used as helper to calculate the standard deviation or when merging nodes.
        Parameters:
        attribute - The attribute whose squared ratings are calculated
        Returns:
        the sum of squared ratings of attribute

      • calcStdDevOfAttribute

        public static double calcStdDevOfAttribute(java.util.Collection<IAttribute> attributes)
        Calculates the standard deviation of attribute if nodes in possibleMerge were merged.
        Parameters:
        attributes - The attributes whose standard deviation is calculated
        Returns:
        The standard deviation of attribute in the nodes. Returns acuity if no node in possibleMerge contains the attribute.
